description:
Farce of the human intellect by Ali Alwardi

Ali Alwardi 1913 - 1995 is a leading sociologist from Iraq, he is one of the few who wrote about society and devoted his life to it. 

Ali Alwardi launched a relentless campaign against some priests, especially in The preachers of the sultan and his other book "farce of the human intellect" and accused them of the impartiality with the leader and ignore the nation's interests at the expense of their religious duties. He called for the renunciation of sectarian differences between Shiites, Sunnis, and should be given to the subject of dispute between the companions of Imam Ali, and that otherwise the historic obsolete and Muslims should instead be inspired attitudes and views of these historic leaders. 

Received master's degree in 1946 from the University of Texas, USA. 
Received a doctorate title in 1950 from the University of Texas, USA.
